bibl.title: Thomas Allen v. John H. McGraw. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
IN THE DISTRICT COURT
Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the County of King.
HABEAS CORPUS. The People of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of King County Greeting:
We command you, that you have the body of Thomas Allen byn you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name Thomas Allen shall be called or charged, before the HON. C H Hanford Ricard A. Jones Judge of the aforesaid Court at my chambers in the Court House in the City of Seattle, at the hour of 10 oclock A.M. April 19th A D 1889 to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning him the said Thomas Allen And have you then and there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON C H Hanford Ricard A. Jones Jude of said District Court, and the seal therof this 18th day of April A. D. 1889. W E Leagewood Clerk. By Deputy Clerk.

No. 6739 In District Court, Third Judicial District, Holding Terms at Seattle, W. T.
In the Matter of the Application of Thomas A;;en For Writ of Habeas Corpus.
HABEAS CORPUS.
FILED APR 19 1889 W E Ledgerwood Clerk. Returned and filed this day of A.D. 188 Clerk. By Deputy Clerk.
